title: 113_hr2866
content: The Act may be cited as the "Boys Town Centennial Commemorative Coin Act". Boys Town is a nonprofit organization founded in 1917 by Father Flanagan in Nebraska. It serves children of all races and religions and has expanded to 11 regions across the country. Father Flanagan's work gained global recognition after the success of the 1938 movie "Boys Town". President Truman asked Father Flanagan to spread his message worldwide, leading to his visits to war orphans and advising government leaders on caring for displaced children. Boys Town provides care to children and families in 11 regions across the country, including California, Nevada, Texas, Nebraska, Iowa, Louisiana, Florida, Washington, DC, New York, and New England. The Boys Town National Hotline offers counseling to over 150,000 callers annually. The Boys Town National Research Hospital is a leader in hearing care and Usher Syndrome research. Boys Town programs impact over 2,000,000 children and families in America each year, with the 100th anniversary of Boys Town in Nebraska approaching on December 12th, 2017. SEC. 3. COIN SPECIFICATIONS. The Secretary of the Treasury will mint and issue commemorative $5 gold coins, $1 silver coins, and half dollar clad coins in honor of the centennial of Father Flanagan's Boys Town. The coins will have specific weights, diameters, and compositions as outlined in the Act. The coins minted under this Act will weigh 11.34 grams, have a diameter of 1.205 inches, and meet the specifications for half dollar coins. They will be legal tender and considered numismatic items. The design of the coins minted under this Act will symbolize Boys Town's 100 years of service. Each coin will feature the coin's value, the year 2017, and inscriptions of "Liberty", "In God We Trust", "United States of America", and "E Pluribus Unum". The design will be chosen by the Secretary in consultation with Boys Town's National Executive Director and the Commission of Fine Arts, and reviewed by the Citizens of Coinage Advisory Committee. Coins minted under this Act will be issued in uncirculated and proof qualities at a single United States Mint facility. The Secretary is authorized to issue these coins only between January 1, 2017, and December 31, 2017. The coins issued under this Act will be sold by the Secretary at a price equal to the face value plus the cost of designing and issuing. Bulk sales will be offered at a discount, and prepaid orders will be accepted with a reasonable discount. SEC. 7. SURCHARGES. Sales of coins under this Act include surcharges: $35 for $5 coin, $10 for $1 coin, $5 for half dollar coin. Surcharges go to Boys Town for helping children and families in underserved communities. SEC. 8. FINANCIAL ASSURANCES. SEC. 8. FINANCIAL ASSURANCES. The Secretary will ensure minting coins incurs no net cost to the government and all costs are recovered before disbursing funds to recipients.
